title: Trent Alexander-Arnold's trophy desire after Liverpool's Champions League success
text:

Trent Alexander-Arnold says he has a hunger for more trophies after Liverpool's Champions League triumph last season.

Alexander-Arnold is targeting silverware success with both Liverpool and England, insisting he will never be satisfied no matter how many trophies are in the cabinet.

The 21-year-old played a crucial role in Liverpool's Champions League success - not least with the cheeky corner that played in Divock Origi for the goal that completed a comeback victory over Barcelona in the semi-final.

Liverpool are currently eight points clear at the top of the Premier League as Jurgen Klopp's men continue to take inspiration from their European Cup success back in June.

And Alexander-Arnold is also targeting Euro 2020 glory with England, with the Group A table-toppers looking to build on their 100% record so far when they face Czech Republic on Friday and Bulgaria three days later.

(Image: PA)

The right-back was asked what fuels his ambitions - and says he only has one thing on his mind.

“What drives me on?” he said. “The main thing is winning trophies. Wanting to leave a legacy behind and feeling you had an impact on club and country and to be remembered.

“That is the main aim – to win as many trophies as possible and go as far as possible in tournaments.

"I won the Champions League in the summer but it is the same as if you have not won a trophy. You want to do it more often.

(Image: PETER POWELL/EPA-EFE/REX)

“That determination and hunger to win never really dies out.

“No matter how many you win, it will never be enough. You need to keep pushing to get better as a player and as a team, whoever you are playing for.

“The aim is always to win and that is the mentality I have got at the minute.”
description: Liverpool and England right-back is targeting silverware success with club and country ahead of Euro 2020 qualifiers
